--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...> 
wro=
te:
>
> If there is not a goal in natural evolution (direct or not), any 
>=
 possible form of life would have survived..
>

This discussion is exposing=
 an interesting philosophical question 
about whether natural evolution has=
 any real goal.

I guess you could say the goal is to reproduce, but if you=
 say that, 
then I want to define TBE as "evolution where reproduction is b=
ased on 
performance on a prior-defined goal other than reproduction itself=
."  
That is, if you make reproduction itself a "target," then the term TBE=
 
becomes meaningless.  

(Perhaps one could argue that it indeed is meanin=
gless anyway, but I 
think it can be a useful term because I believe it mak=
es a useful 
distinction between some types of evolution and others for the=
 
purposes of discussion.)

ken
